subject: Re: ActiveTestSuite with JUnit 4.x
msgSnippet: David, the overhead comes from the cumbersome development of the test of a applicaton in a concurrent environment. Overhead=my overhead as a developer to
messageBody:
David,

the overhead comes from the cumbersome development of the test of a
applicaton in a concurrent environment. Overhead=my overhead as a
developer to develop these types of test using JUnit 4.x.

Michael



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Michael,
>
> I missed what you're saying here. Is the overhead imposed when tests
> are run sequentially, or concurrently? Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
> Michael Hüttermann wrote:
> > because all tests are run sequentially, it is impossible without a big
> > overhead application side.
> >
> > Michael
> >
> >
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@> wrote:
> >
> >> Michael,
> >>
> >> I'm not aware of one. It should be doable, and much easier once the
> >> runner extension architecture is refactored. Thanks,
> >>
> >> David Saff
> >>
> >> Michael Hüttermann wrote:
> >>
> >>> Hello,
> >>>
> >>> how can I write a concurrent test suite with annotations. Is
there any
> >>> simple example available for that?
> >>>
> >>> Thanks.
> >>>
> >>> Michal
